intro: Cyrtochiloides riopalenqueana, commonly known as the Río Palenque orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant typically grows on tree bark, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with contrasting patterns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
